verse.roman:
citraseno nariṣyantād
ṛkṣas tasya suto 'bhavat
tasya mīḍhvāṁs tataḥ pūrṇa
indrasenas tu tat-sutaḥ

synonyms: citrasenaḥ—one named Citrasena; nariṣyantāt—from Nariṣyanta, another son of Manu; ṛkṣaḥ—Ṛkṣa; tasya—of Citrasena; sutaḥ—the son; abhavat—became; tasya—of him (Ṛkṣa); mīḍhvān—Mīḍhvān; tataḥ—from him (Mīḍhvān); pūrṇaḥ—Pūrṇa; indrasenaḥ—Indrasena; tu—but; tat-sutaḥ—the son of him (Pūrṇa).
translation: From Nariṣyanta came a son named Citrasena and from him a son named Ṛkṣa. From Ṛkṣa came Mīḍhvān, from Mīḍhvān came Pūrṇa, and from Pūrṇa came Indrasena.
